title: So i got permabanned. Did i deserve it?
body: Yes i did. Case closed. Time for new account. I don't know why Riot doesn't seem to realize that banning people doesn't reduce toxicity.

What 0 tolerance policy are you talking about? You don't just get perma banned for a little bit of toxicity every now and then. You get warnings, a short ban and then perma banned. And you have to consistently  be toxic to even recieve any form of punishment including warnings. Their punishment system is actually really lenient.

It's not like they will need it later.

The perma bans are good because now they have to have a new main account.  So they ether adopt the attitude you are talking about and constantly have new accounts banned or they straighten up.
Why wouldn't banning people reduce toxicity?
People just play on different accounts.

Conceivably, many/most who are banned will then tread lightly to avoid being banned again, and those who are not banned would be incentivized to be on their best behavior so as to not lose out on their rank, IP gains, RP investments, etc. 

Sure, some assholes will simply make a new account and continue to be assholes, but it's a deterrent.
